author: Derek Main
message: @Ibo Thabo I hear you. How do you propose we resolve that issue? @Fello Mkhize A STRATCOM president Just because JZ didn't have the authority to authorise landing doesn't mean he didn't put pressure on officials. @Ibo Thabo Yes - I agree that's important and necessary. But how do we all communicate? Surely we need to choose a common language in order to do that? @Ibo Thabo I'm not saying that common language has to be English but it has to be one language we must all learn. "@Thando Nkutha I understand that - I'm sure everyone feels more comfortable speaking in a language they know well. In a way @Thando Nkutha It's a valuable skill to learn. @Pastor JJ It seems the intention was always to share out the spoils (however those came about) amongst the top cadres. "@Vukani Mngomezulu That begs the question of why officials would quake in their boots when the Guptas told them : ""This is what #1 wants"". They must have known that the Guptas were tight with Zuma." @Naledzani Mashau Too true - corrupt to the core. @Ibo Thabo I'll second that @Dominic Przybylski The only problem is that they use different user names so you have to keep blocking each new one. @Born free Easy for them to pay that with our money. @Dominic Przybylski Yes - I understand that. Don't understand how that speaks to what I said. @Dominic Przybylski Oh I see. Not sure. @Dominic Przybylski Yes - I was thinking that too. Maybe using IP spoofing so Youtube can't block IP. Her report seems to have been a whitewash in the same way the Seriti Arms Deal commission was. I think the investigation into the Waterkloof landing should be reopened. We haven't got to the truth of it yet. "In fact @Thapelo Motabogi I think he looks quite dapper. Couldn't happen to a nicer guy. @Ibo Thabo I don't appreciate the racist undertones. The judge speaks English because SA law states that all judicial processes are to be conducted in English. Not any other reason. @Ibo Thabo We've already been through the debate of why we have to have a common language. I'm not going there again. @Ibo Thabo Scroll back in this chat then. I've said what I have to say on that. @Thando Nkutha I think you meant isiZuru. @carnoth ngomane Yeah - why lie in English when you can lie in your own language. @Thando Nkutha Been through the language debate already today. See above. @carnoth ngomane Exactly @carnoth ngomane Agreed - I said already that SA law allows for interpreters in legal cases and anyone should feel free to use one. @Ibo Thabo You've just promoted him. @Ibo Thabo You've promoted every African to general? Wow!
